astroBiz.util

Class textUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • astroBiz.util.textUtilities

  • public class textUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    All non-standard methods for doing things to Strings go in this class.
    Now also contains methods to draw sprite based text.
    Author:
    Matt Bangert

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int charHeight 
      static int charWidth 
      static java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.awt.Point> textMap
      Hash Map for all usable sprite based text characters.
      static SpriteSheet textSheet
      The Sprite Sheet containing all available characters.

      Method to determine the number of lines that text will occupy

      static void init()
      Initialize textUtilities.
      This absolutely must be done if you have any
      intention of using textMap, which is basically required
      for using any of the sprite based text functions contained
      in textUtilities.
      static java.lang.String replaceCharAt(int position, java.lang.String string, char c)
      Method to replace the character at a specific location within a String.

      • init

        public static void init()
        Initialize textUtilities.
        This absolutely must be done if you have any
        intention of using textMap, which is basically required
        for using any of the sprite based text functions contained
        in textUtilities.

      • boxText

        public static void boxText(java.awt.Graphics g,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int borderwidth,
                           java.awt.Color bordercolor,
                           java.awt.Color framecolor,
                           java.lang.String text)
        Create a single-line text box
        Parameters:
        g - (Graphics) Graphics to draw it with
        x - (int) Starting X coordinate of the box
        y - (int) Starting Y coordinate of the box
        borderwidth - (int) The width of the box's border.
        bordercolor - (Color) The color of the box's border.
        framecolor - (Color) The color of the interior of the box.
        text - (String) The text contained in the box.

      • colorizeString

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage colorizeString(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                          java.awt.Color c)
        Change the color of the default sprite-based text.
        Parameters:
        img - (BufferedImage) The sprite text character to be changed in color.
        c - (Color) The color to which the sprite text character will be changed.
        Returns:
        (BufferedImage) The colorized spriite text character.

      • drawString

        public static void drawString(java.awt.Graphics g,
                              int x,
                              int y,
                              java.lang.String text)
        Method to draw a sprite based text string to the screen.
        Parameters:
        g - (Graphics) The desired Graphics buffer.
        x - (int) The X coordinate of the text.
        y - (int) The Y coordinate of the text.
        text - (String) The string of text to draw.
        Note: Sprite based text draws from top-left to bottom-right.
        Ergo, the x,y value is the top-left corner of the text.

      • drawString

        public static void drawString(java.awt.Graphics g,
                              int x,
                              int y,
                              java.lang.String text,
                              java.awt.Color c)
        Method to draw a sprite based string of the specified color.
        Parameters:
        g - (Graphics) The desired Graphics buffer.
        x - (int) The X coordinate of the text.
        y - (int) The Y coordinate of the text.
        text - (String) The string of text to draw.
        c - (Color) The desired color of the text.
        Note: Sprite based text draws from top-left to bottom-right.
        Ergo, the x,y value is the top-left corner of the text.

      • drawStringMultiLine

        public static void drawStringMultiLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                       int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int width,
                                       java.lang.String text)
        Method to draw sprite based text across multiple lines.
        Parameters:
        g - (Graphics) The desired Graphics buffer.
        x - (int) The X coordinate of the text.
        y - (int) The Y coordinate of the text.
        width - (int) The width [in pixels] of the String before it goes to a new line.
        text - (String) The string of text to draw.
        Note: Sprite based text draws from top-left to bottom-right.
        Ergo, the x,y value is the top-left corner of the text.

      • drawStringMultiLine

        public static void drawStringMultiLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                       int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int width,
                                       java.lang.String text,
                                       java.awt.Color c)
        Method to draw sprite based text of a specified color across multiple lines.
        Parameters:
        g - (Graphics) The desired Graphics buffer.
        x - (int) The X coordinate of the text.
        y - (int) The Y coordinate of the text.
        width - (int) The width [in pixels] of the String before it goes to a new line.
        text - (String) The string of text to draw.
        c - (Color) The desired color of the text.
        Note: Sprite based text draws from top-left to bottom-right.
        Ergo, the x,y value is the top-left corner of the text.

      • drawStringMultiLine

        public static void drawStringMultiLine(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                       java.awt.Font f,
                                       int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int lineWidth,
                                       java.lang.String text)
        Automagically splits a string over multiple lines.
        Note: The string must contain spaces to be split!
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics
        f - The font being used for the string.
        x - String X coordinate
        y - String Y coordinate
        lineWidth - How wide the string can be before splitting.
        text - The actual string.

public static void drawMenuTextBox(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                                int x,
                                                int y,

        Deprecated. 
        Use boxText(Graphics, int, int, int, Color, Color, String)
        Method to draw a box around text.
        Parameters:

        x - (int) The X coordinate of the box.
        y - (int) The Y coordinate of the box.
        width - (int) The width of the box.

      • drawMenuTextBox

        @Deprecated
public static void drawMenuTextBox(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                                java.awt.Font f,
                                                int x,
                                                int y,
                                                int width,
                                                int height,
                                                java.lang.String text)

        Method to draw text within a box.
        Parameters:
        g - (Graphics) The graphics buffer.
        f - (Font) The desired Font.
        x - (int) The X coordinate of the box.
        y - (int) The Y coordinate of the box.
        width - (int) The width of the box.
        height - (int) The height of the box.
        text - (String) The text to be drawn inside the box.

      • getLineCount

        public static int getLineCount(java.lang.String text,
                               int width)
        Method to determine the number of lines that text will occupy
        if wrapped to a given width.
        Parameters:
        text - (String) The text to analyze.
        width - (int) The width [in pixels] of the text before triggering a new line.
        Returns:
        (int) The number of lines calculated.

      • addEndChar

        public static java.lang.String addEndChar(java.lang.String string,
                                          char c)
        Method to add a character to the end of the specified String.
        Parameters:
        string - (String) The String to which the character will be added.
        c - (char) The character to add.
        Returns:
        (String) A new String comprised of the original String and the specified character.

      • deleteEndChar

        public static java.lang.String deleteEndChar(java.lang.String string)
        Method to remove the final character of a String.
        Parameters:
        string - (String) The string from which the final character will be removed.
        Returns:
        (String) The modified String.

      • replaceCharAt

        public static java.lang.String replaceCharAt(int position,
                                             java.lang.String string,
                                             char c)
        Method to replace the character at a specific location within a String.
        Parameters:
        position - (int) The position of the character to be replaced.
        string - (String) The string in which the character will be replaced.
        c - (char) The replacing character.
        Returns:
        (String) The updated String.
